trans-unit.source: Returns the next filename defined by the search handle.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the next filename defined by the search handle.

target.mrk: Returns the next filename defined by the search handle.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The search handle, as returned by FileFindFirstFile().

seg-source.mrk: The search handle, as returned by FileFindFirstFile().

target.mrk: The search handle, as returned by FileFindFirstFile().

trans-unit.source: [optional] this flag determines whether to return detailed file attribute information in @extended.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
this flag determines whether to return detailed file attribute information in @extended.

target.mrk: [optional]
this flag determines whether to return detailed file attribute information in @extended.

trans-unit.source: 0 = (default) use @extended to return 1 or 0 if search item is a directory.

seg-source.mrk: 0 = (default) use @extended to return 1 or 0 if search item is a directory.

target.mrk: 0 = (default) use @extended to return 1 or 0 if search item is a directory.

trans-unit.source: 1 = Return a string in @extended in the same format as FileGetAttrib().

seg-source.mrk: 1 = Return a string in @extended in the same format as FileGetAttrib().

target.mrk: 1 = Return a string in @extended in the same format as FileGetAttrib().

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: a filename according to a previous call to FileFindFirstFile(), @extended set as per the flag option.

seg-source.mrk: a filename according to a previous call to FileFindFirstFile(), @extended set as per the flag option.

target.mrk: a filename according to a previous call to FileFindFirstFile(), @extended set as per the flag option.

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to 1 if no more files/directories match the search.

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to 1 if no more files/directories match the search.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to 1 if no more files/directories match the search.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: A previous call to FileFindFirstFile() is necessary to setup the search and get a search handle. Every subsequent call to FileFindNextFile() will return the next file found according to the search handle supplied to FileFindFirstFile(). When @error = 1, no more files found matching the original search handle.

seg-source.mrk: A previous call to FileFindFirstFile() is necessary to setup the search and get a search handle.
Every subsequent call to FileFindNextFile() will return the next file found according to the search handle supplied to FileFindFirstFile().
When @error = 1, no more files found matching the original search handle.

target.mrk: A previous call to FileFindFirstFile() is necessary to setup the search and get a search handle.
Every subsequent call to FileFindNextFile() will return the next file found according to the search handle supplied to FileFindFirstFile().
When @error = 1, no more files found matching the original search handle.

trans-unit.source: When you have finished searching with the FileFind... functions you must call FileClose() to release the search handle.

seg-source.mrk: When you have finished searching with the FileFind... functions you must call FileClose() to release the search handle.

target.mrk: When you have finished searching with the FileFind... functions you must call FileClose() to release the search handle.

trans-unit.source: Due to the underlying Windows API used (FindFirstFile), this function actually searches both the long and short filenames when looking for matches. If you get unexepected results

seg-source.mrk: Due to the underlying Windows API used (FindFirstFile), this function actually searches both the long and short filenames when looking for matches.
If you get unexepected results

target.mrk: Due to the underlying Windows API used (FindFirstFile), this function actually searches both the long and short filenames when looking for matches.
If you get unexepected results

trans-unit.source: then verfiy that it's not the short filename that is being matched.

target.mrk: then verfiy that it's not the short filename that is being matched.
